Name: !hackandslash
Description: When you *attack an enemy in melee*, roll+Str.
Crit: You deal your damage to the enemy and avoid their attack. At your option, you may choose to do +1d6 damage but expose yourself to the enemy’s attack.
Hit: You deal your damage to the enemy, and the enemy makes an attack against you.

Name: !volley
Description: When you take aim and *shoot at an enemy at range*, roll+Dex.
Crit: You have a clear shot; deal your damage.
Hit:
Choose one (whichever you choose, you deal your damage):
• You have to move to get the shot placing you in danger of the GM’s choice.
• You have to take what you can get: -1d6 damage.
• You have to take several shots, reducing your ammo by one.

Name: !parley
Description: When you *have leverage on a GM character and manipulate them*, roll+Cha. (Leverage is something they need or want.)
Crit: They ask you for something and do it if you make them a promise first.
Hit: They need some concrete assurance of your promise, right now.

Name: !defydanger
Description:
When you *act despite an imminent threat* or suffer a calamity, say how you deal with it and roll. If you do it...
• by powering through, +Str
• by getting out of the way or acting fast, +Dex
• by enduring, +Con
• with quick thinking, +Int
• through mental fortitude, +Wis
• with song, charm, or social grace, +Cha
Crit: You do what you set out to; the threat doesn’t come to bear.
Hit: You stumble, hesitate, or flinch: the GM will offer you a worse outcome, hard bargain, or ugly choice.

Name: !defend
Description:
When you *stand in defense of a person, item, or location* under attack, roll+Con.
So long as you stand in defense, when you or the thing you defend is attacked you may spend hold, 1 for 1, to choose an option:
• Halve the attack’s effect or damage
• Open up the attacker to an ally giving that ally +1 forward against the attacker
• Deal damage to the attacker equal to your level

Name: !discernrealities
Description: When you *closely study a situation or person*, roll+Wis.
Crit:
Ask the GM three questions from the list below. Take +1 forward when acting on the answers.

• What happened here recently?
• What is about to happen?
• What should I be on the lookout for?
• What here is useful or valuable to me?
• Who’s really in control here?
• What here is not what it appears to be?
Hit:
Ask the GM one question from the list below. Take +1 forward when acting on the answer.

• What happened here recently?
• What is about to happen?
• What should I be on the lookout for?
• What here is useful or valuable to me?
• Who’s really in control here?
• What here is not what it appears to be?

Name: !spoutlore
Description: When you *consult your accumulated knowledge about something*, roll+Int.
Crit: The GM will tell you something interesting and useful about the subject relevant to your situation.
Hit: The GM will only tell you something interesting—it’s on you to make it useful. The GM might ask you “How do you know this?” Tell them the truth, now.

Name: !aidorinterfere
Description: When you *help or hinder someone you have a Bond with*, roll+Bond with them.
Hit: They take 1 or -2, your choice, and you also expose yourself to danger, retribution, or cost.
Miss: You fail to aid or interfere!
